legendaryGroup.name: Hogger
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Hogger takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: Hogger screams for aid. 1d4 {@creature Gnoll|WC5E MoM|gnolls} within 300 feet of Hogger that can hear him rush to his side, appearing in a space within 60 feet of him. This lair action has no effect if there are no gnolls within 300 feet of Hogger.
Each gnoll that Hogger can see can use its reaction to move up to its speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.
Until the next initiative count 20, all gnolls within the lair are enraged, causing them to have advantage on melee weapon attack rolls and causing attack rolls to have advantage against them.

regionalEffects: Hogger's lair might have any or all of the following effects in place:

items: The lair is considered difficult terrain for any non-gnoll creature that moves across it.
Any gnoll within the lair has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the yeti moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 18 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The yeti's long jump is up to 40 ft. and its high jump is up to 20 ft., with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The yeti makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Roar
entries: The yeti emits a roar. Each creature within 30 feet of the yeti and able to hear the roar must make a DC15 Wisdom saving throw, being Frightened for 1 minute on a fail. A Frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the roar of all yetis for 1 day.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the yeti jumps at least 20 ft. as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 30 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

On a successful save, the creature takes only half of the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone} and is pushed 5 ft. out of the yeti space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the yeti space.

action.name: Cold Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The yeti exhales an icy blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 6d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Claw Attack
entries: The yeti makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Leap Attack (Cost 2 actions)
entries: The yeti makes a deadly leap attack.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The abomination is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the abomination must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all abominations for 1 minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The abomination makes two attacks: one with its cleaver and one with its horrific hook.

action.name: Cleaver
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Horrific Hook
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} and pulled to an empty space next to the abomination.

trait.name: Air Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Whirlwind {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature in the elemental's space must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 15 ({@damage 3d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and is flung up to 20 feet away from the elemental in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 ({@dice 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.
If the save is successful, the target takes half the damage and isn't flung away or knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: DANGER!
entries: When the alarm-o-bot notices a creature that isn't a construct or gnome it sends out a warning that can be heard within 240 feet of it.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The alarm-o-bot is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}0 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Beast of Burden
entries: The kodo is considered to be a Gargantuan animal for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the kodo moves at least 20 feet straight towards a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the kodo can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Gore
entries: Melee Attack Weapon: {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: Melee Attack Weapon: {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Devour
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage. A Medium or smaller target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or swallowed by the kodo. The kodo can only have one target swallowed at a time. If a target fails the saving throw while the kodo has a creature swallowed, it is {@condition grappled} instead.

A swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the kodo, and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the kodo's turns.

If the kodo takes 15 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the kodo must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the kodo. If the kodo dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the ancient remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The ancient deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ancient makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Take Root
entries: The ancient buries its roots in the ground. While rooted, the ancient's speed becomes 0, it gains advantage on its attack rolls, and is immune to any effect that would force the ancient to move or be moved. The ancient can end this effect by repeating this action to uproot itself.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ancient is a 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It requires no material components to cast its spells. The ancient has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the ancient remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The ancient deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Speak with Nature
entries: The ancient can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ancient makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 5d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Take Root
entries: The ancient buries its roots in the ground. While rooted, the ancient's speed becomes 0, it gains advantage on its attack rolls, and is immune to any effect that would force the ancient to move or be moved. The ancient can end this effect by repeating this action to uproot itself.

variant.name: Tree of Life
entries: A tree of life is a sapling born from the world tree Nordrassil, these ancients have suffered great losses in recent wars, and those who remain have returned to the forest to spread their seeds and replenish their numbers undisturbed.
A tree of life has a challenge rating of 10 (5,900 XP). It has the same statistics as an ancient of lore, and gains the following additional traits:

entries.name: Nature's Blessing.
entries: The tree add its Wisdom modifier to its Armor Class (AC 19).

entries.name: Rooted Tranquility.
entries: While the tree have taken root, each plant of the tree's choice within 60 feet of it regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the plant takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the plant's next turn. A plant dies if it starts its turn with 0 hit points.

entries.name: Spellcasting.
entries: The tree has the following additional spells prepared.

items: 4th level: {@i {@spell guardian of nature|xge}, {@spell grasping vine}}

entries: The tree has the following additional action option:

entries.name: Summon {@creature Wisp|WC5E MoM|Wisps} (1/Day).
entries: The tree calls forth ten wisps that appear in empty spaces within 60 feet of it. These wisps act as allies of the tree. The wisps remains for 1 day or until they die.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the ancient remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

trait.name: Resilient Nature
entries: Unless the ancient of war is incapacitated, it and plant creatures of its choice within 60 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The ancient deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ancient makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 5d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}42 ({@dice 8d8 + 6}) bludgeoning.

action.name: Take Root
entries: The ancient buries its roots in the ground. While rooted, the ancient's speed becomes 0, it gains advantage on its attack rolls, and is immune to any effect that would force the ancient to move or be moved. The ancient can end this effect by repeating this action to uproot itself.

action.name: Animate Trees (1/Day)
entries: The ancient magically animates five or fewer trees that it can see within 60 feet of it. The trees have the statistics of a treant, except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1 and they only have the Claw action. An animated tree acts as an ally of the ancient. The tree remains animated for 1 day, until it dies, or until the ancient takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. If the tree doesn't die and is made inanimate, it takes root again if it can.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 25/50 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Apparition
languages: understands any language it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The apparition is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The apparition has the following mage spells prepared:

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The apparition can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the apparition has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk mw} Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 4d6 + 1}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Arcane Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. When the elemental enters the area of an {@spell antimagic field} spell for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the spell save DC of its spellcaster, or be {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The elemental sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light in an additional 15 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two touch attacks.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Arcane Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The elemental erupts arcane energy at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 4d4}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Arcane Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The golem's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}). The golem can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapon
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Arcane Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) force damage.

action.name: Slow {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The nullifier is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nullifier makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Slow {@recharge 5}
entries: The nullifier targets one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The creature must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, the creature can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the creature can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The effect lasts for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

action.name: Nullify (Recharge after a Long Rest)
entries: The nullifier attempts to dispel all magical effects within 30 feet of it, as if it had cast the {@spell dispel magic} as a 3rd-level spell on everything within range.

reaction.name: Reflection Field
entries: When a creature hits the nullifier with a ranged spell attack, the nullifier can reflect the spell onto a target within 15 feet of it.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the wyrm dies, it explodes in a burst of arcane. Each creature within 15 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Magic Sense
entries: The wyrm can sense magic users within 30 feet of it, and focus its attacks on those creatures.

trait.name: Mana Burn
entries: Whenever the wyrm hits a target with its bite, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw or have their lowest available spell slot expended. The target regains any spell slots lost in this way when they finish a short rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wyrm makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) force damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) force damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) if the wyrm isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Faerie Fire (1/Day)
entries: The wyrm manifests the effects of a {@spell faerie fire} spell within 60 feet of it (spell save {@dc 12}).

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The moth sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

An {@b ashwing moth} is a nocturnal creature, best known for its vibrant light. Assassins prize them for it, using it as a decoy or distraction, as well as a subtle light in dark places. An ashwing moth in captivity sheds light for up to {@dice 1d8} days.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

{@b Axebeaks} are jungle birds with multicolored chest plumage. They are named after their brightly colored bills, which are razor sharp and help them crack open thick tropical fruit and chop open the corpses they scavenge.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The baboon has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the baboon's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The badger has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Detect Life
entries: The banshee can magically sense the presence of living creatures up to 5 miles away. She knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The banshee can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The banshee can use its Banshee's Curse. It then makes two attacks with its withering touch.

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Banshee's Curse
entries: One creature of the banshee's choice within 60 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on all ability checks, saving throws, and attack rolls until the end of the banshee's next turn.

action.name: Wail {@recharge 4}
entries: The banshee releases a mournful wail. This wail has no effect on constructs and undead. All other creatures within 30 feet of her that can hear her must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d12}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Possession (1/Day)
entries: One humanoid that the banshee can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the banshee; the banshee then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. The banshee now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The banshee can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the banshee ends it as a bonus action, or the banshee is turned or forced out by an effect like the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell. When the possession ends, the banshee reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body.

reaction.name: Anti-magic Shell
entries: The banshee adds 3 to its AC against one spell attack that would hit it. To do so, the banshee must see the attacker.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the lasher remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary orchid.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lasher makes two thorn slash attacks.

action.name: Thorn Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Thorn Volley
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) poison damage.

reaction.name: Thorn Shield
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the lasher hits it with a melee attack, the creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw if the basilisk isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} until freed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic.

A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again.  If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the basilisk sees its reflection within 30 feet of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@i Hit} 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The bat can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The bat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell

action.name: Claws

action.name: Thorn Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Whirlwind Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: The lasher lashes out in all directions with thorny vines, tearing any opponent within range. Each creature in a 10-foot radius centered on the lasher must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the boar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the boar takes 7 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Tusk

trait.name: Detonate
entries: When the bombling dies, it detonates in a 10-foot radius explosion. Any creature within range must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The bombling is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Self-destruct
entries: The bombling immediately detonates, killing itself in the process.

action.name: Claws

action.name: Stomp

action.name: Tail

A {@b carrion bird} is a large, carnivorous scavenger bird found across Azeroth. Their wings are broad and their heads often featherless. They stalk their prey from the skies, lurking from a distance, as they wait for it to fall -- whether from exhaustion, or from another hunter.

If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition that hits the core hound is destroyed after dealing damage.

entries: {@atk mw} +10 to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the devilsaur and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Maim
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the devilsaur's bite takes 59 ({@damage 8d12 + 7}) piercing damage. If this reduces the creature to 0 hp, the devilsaur swallows it and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the devilsaur, and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the devilsaur's turns.

If the Devilsaur takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from creatures inside it, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of it. If the devilsaur dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by him and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

If no creature is near enough to move and attack, the troll attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the troll goes berserk, it continues to dos so until its killed or regains all its hit points.

trait.name: Amphibious

trait.name: Slow and Steady
entries: The dragon turtle's speed is not reduced from pushing, dragging, or lifting more than its carrying capacity.

trait.name: Stable
entries: Whenever an effect knocks the turtle {@condition prone}, it can make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}. A {@condition prone} turtle is upside down. To stand up, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity check on its turn and then use all its movement for that turn.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shell Defense
entries: The turtle withdraws itself into its shell. Until it emerges it gain +4 bonus to AC and has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in its shell, it is {@condition prone}, its speed is 0 and can't increase, it has disadvantage on Dexerity saving throws, it can't take reactions, and the only action it can take is a bonus action to emerge from its shell.

Wild {b dragon turtles} are vicious, with sharp jaws and a nasty temper. When domesticated however, they make ideal rides for the pandaren, able to carry heavy loads (a necessity for any pandaren mount) with an even gait that can lull them into any easy sleep.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The dragonhawk has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the dragonhawk is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragonhawk makes two attacks with its talons.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragonhawk exhales fire  in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Air Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two attacks: one with its slam and one with its gust.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Gust
entries: One target must make a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 7 ({@dice 2d6}) bludgeoning damage and is flung up to 20 feet directly away from the elemental and knocked {@condition prone}. If the saving throw is successful, the target only takes half damage and isn't flung away or knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Upheaval {@recharge 4}
entries: The elemental pushes dust upwards at a point it can see within 15 feet of it. Each creature other than the elemental within 5 feet of the upheaval must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of the elemental's next turn. The elemental needs loose earth, rock, or something similar to use upheaval.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The eagle has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The elemental can burrow through nonmagical unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the elekk moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the elekk can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

The great {@b elekks} are among the oldest living species on Draenor. These trunked creatures move in herds and while generally peaceful as long as their young and water supply are unthreatened, can use their four tusks to deadly effect. The draenei have been known to use them as beasts of burden, using Light-infused crystals to render them more docile.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks and weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The worgen has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on its hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The worgen has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the worgen's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The worgen's long jump is up to 30 ft. and its high jump is up to 20 ft., with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The worgen makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or gain the {@reward worgen curse}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Fire Form
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The elemental sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light in an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
entries: For every 5 feet the elemental moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two touch attacks

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of its turn.

trait.name: Damage Transfer
entries: While attached to a creature, the fleshbeast takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down), and that creature takes the other half.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fleshbeast makes two attacks: one with its tentacle and one with its bite. If attached it makes two bite attacks against the creature it is attached to instead.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Small or larger, the fleshbeast attaches to it, moving into its space which is shared with the target. The fleshbeast's movement speed becomes 0 and it gains advantage on bite attacks against the target. In addition, at the start of each of the target's turns, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage and if the target moves the fleshbeast moves with it. The fleshbeast can detach itself as a bonus action, in which case it regains its movement speed and needs to spend that movement speed to move out of the target's space. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the fleshbeast by succeeding on a {@dc 14} Strength check.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 3 ({@dice 1d6}) on a failure. The disease is cured on a success. The target dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the disease is cured. A swarm of insect's crawl out of a creature {@dice 1d4} rounds after it died if it was diseased upon its death.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

variant.name: Furbolg Shaman
entries: Some furbolgs devote themselves to becoming a shaman for their tribe. A furbolg shaman has a challenge rating of 3 (700 XP) and gains the Spellcasting trait.

entries.name: Spellcasting.
entries: The furbolg is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following shaman spells prepared:

items: 1st level (4 slots): {@i {@spell chromatic orb}, {@spell cure wounds}, {@spell fog cloud}, {@spell thunderwave}}
2nd level (2 slots): {@i {@spell heat metal}, {@spell lesser restoration}}

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the ghost can utter a special command or warning whenever a non-hostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the ghost. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The ghost enters the Spirit World from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Spirit World, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The ghost adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

action.name: Cannibalize (Recharge after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The ghoul cannibalizes the corpse of a humanoid that has been dead for less than a day, regaining 10 hit points. Each creature of the ghoul's choice that is within 30 feet of the ghoul and can see it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any ghoul's cannibalize for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The frog makes one bite attack against a Small or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the frog, and it takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage at the start of each of the frog's turns. The frog can have only one target swallowed at a time. If the frog dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement exiting {@condition prone}.

entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the abomination must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all abominations for 1 minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The abomination makes two attacks: one with its cleaver and one with its horrific hook.

action.name: Cannibalize
entries: The abomination cannibalize the corpse of creature that has been dead for less than 24 hours. Each creature of the abomination's choice that is within 120 feet and can see it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the abomination's Cannibalize for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Cleaver
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Engorge
entries: The abomination makes one cleaver attack and places a {@condition grappled} target in its ribcage. The target becomes {@condition restrained}, and can use its action to break free by succeeding on a {@dc 17} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. While {@condition restrained} in this way, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the abominations turns. An abomination can have only one creature {@condition restrained} within its ribcage.

action.name: Horrific Hook
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} and pulled to an empty space next to the abomination.

Despite their name, {@b helboars} are not demons or part of the Burning Legion. As beasts who have been exposed to the energies of the Twisting Nether for long periods of time, simple boars have mutated into this spiked variety, capable of superheating their own skin as a defense mechanism.

trait.name: Frost Form
entries: The elemental can burrow through nonmagical unworked ice and snow. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage. Additionally, the elemental freezes non-creature liquids within a 10-foot radius of it. A creature caught in the liquid when the elemental freezes it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).

variant.name: Candles in the Dark
entries: Kobold legends speak of a devouring presence, hiding in the darkness, giving to them their overwhelming fear of the dark.

A kobold without a lit candle, who is standing in dim light or darkness, must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The kobold can repeat the saving throw at the end of each its turns, also ending the effect if it manages to light a candle again.
On a successful save, if another creature was responsible for the loss of candlelight, the kobold deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d6}) damage when it hits that creature with a melee attack.

A {@b lion} is a common sight across central Kalimdor. These fierce predators stalk the tall grass in small packs -- their prides -- and have been known to even hunt travellers.
More commonplace across Azeroth is the {@b mountain lion}, found both along the lush plains of Mulgore and up the grassy foothills of Hillsbrad.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until the grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the naga cannot constrict another target.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The naga can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The naga has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The naga makes two halberd attacks, one of which can be replaced with its constrict attack.

action.name: Halberd
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until the grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the naga cannot constrict another target.

action.name: Crashing Wave (Recharges 5-6)
entries: The naga charges forward creating a wave of water that crashes anyone on its path. The naga moves 20 feet forward in a straight line producing a wave 20 feet long, 10 feet tall and 10 feet wide . Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 22 ({@damage 5d8}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the naga can utter a special command or warning whenever a non-hostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the naga. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the naga is {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The naga adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the naga must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the ogre can move up to its speed toward an enemy of its choice that it can see or hear. It must end this move closer to the enemy than it started.

trait.name: Mighty Presence
entries: While it is conscious, the ogre and any friendly creature within 10 feet of it has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ogre makes two greatclub attacks, one of which can be replaced with its shockwave.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shockwave {@recharge 5}
entries: The ogre hits the ground with its greatclub causing a burst of concussive force. Each creature in a 15-foot cone  originating from the ogre must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. If the ground in that area is loose earth or stone, it becomes difficult terrain.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ogre is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The ogre has the following mage spells prepared:
footerEntries: The ogre casts mage armor on itself before combat.

trait.name: Two Heads
entries: The ogre has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

action.name: Maul:
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

variant.name: Falcosaur
entries: Falcosaurs are an invasive and predatory dinosaur species that can be found on the coastlines of the Broken Isles. They look like feathered raptors with a huge beak and have a primal need to hunt that develops at a young age. While falcosaurs are predatory, they are actually omnivores and eat fruits as well as berries in large quantities.

items.name: Bloodgazer
entries: While the colors they sport make them look fierce and intimidating, the bloodgazer falcosaurs are predisposed to eating fruit and berries.

items.name: Direbeak
entries: Direbeak falcosaurs are the heartiest of the bunch. Their sense of smell however, is not as good as that of other falcosaur species, which had led them to prefer pungent meals and are often found feasting on carrion that has been in the sun for days. Their shimmering hides have adapted to confuse and disorient prey.
A falcosaur of the direbeak tribe has its {@b {@i Keen Hearing and Smell}} trait replaced by:

entries.name: Shimmering Hide
entries: When a creature attacks the falcosaur, it gets momentarilly disoriented. The attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll.

items.name: Sharptalon
entries: The viridian sharptalon falcosaurs have a diet which subsist mainly on small nuts and berries, their claws are used mostly for defense. Their viridian hide allow for them to blend into magical forests and non-magical forests alike.
A falcosaur of the sharptalon tribe has the additional trait:

entries.name: Veridian Hide
entries: The sharptalon falcosaur has advantage on hiding in forests and woodlands.

items.name: Snowfeather
entries: Snowfeather falcosaur are the most predatory of all known falcosaur species while being particularly fond of large prey. Their hide and fur allow them to hide in fog and fog banks.
A falcosaur of the snowfeather tribe has the additional trait:

entries.name: Snowfeather Hide
entries: The snowfeather falcosaur has advantage on hiding in fog or snow.

{@b Riverbeasts} are great aquatic beasts of Draenor, possessing a rocky plates, a club-like tail, and long lower tusks. While they appear docile at a distance, they are known to be one of the most easily provoked and deadly animals on the planet. Azeroth possess its own variety of riverbeast, though their skin is smooth and they lack the prominent tails of their cousins.

If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until the grapple ends, the zoatroid shares space with it, the target is {@condition blinded}, and the zoatroid can't use its tentacles on another target without ending the grapple.

action.name: Dominate {@recharge}
entries: One humanoid {@condition grappled} by the zoatroid must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be dominated by the zoatroid: the dominated target goes on the zoatroids initiative, it controls the target using its action. The {@i Dominate} deprives the target of its vision but not its awareness. The royal zoatroid can be targeted by attacks, spells, and other effects but any attack roll that misses the zoatroid automatically hits its dominated target.
The domination lasts until the target drops to 0 hit points, the zoatroid ends it as a bonus action, or a creature uses their action to attempt a grapple check contested by the zoatroid.

While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the silithid, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the silithid's turns.

If the silithid takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the silithid must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the silithid. If the silithid dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

A {@b skywisp moth} is considered a docile, insignificant beast to most. Among arcane practitioners, however, they have a notorious reputation for their curiosity and their uncanny ability to interfere with spells cast in their vicinity.
Because of this, they are often a favoured companion for any hunters whose quarry is a dangerous spellcaster.

This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The spectre regains hit points by an amount equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.

{@b Talbuks} are one of the few remaining species of the world Argus. When the draenei fled their homeworld, they brought with them these stag-like creatures, who went on to populate worlds where the draenei had sought refuge such as Draenor and Azeroth. They primarily serve as food and occasionally mounts for the people of the Exodar.
They tend to form groups of multiple does and calves under the protection of a single patriarch, who is fiercely protective of his herd.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the talbuk moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 17 ({@damage 5d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Protector

{@b Tallstriders} are large, flightless birds, native to the plains and savannahs of central Kalimdor. There is a very clear and stubborn pride to the tallstriders, making them near impossible to domesticate and useless as beasts of burden.
Some skilled hunters and beast-handlers have mastered the art of taming a tallstrider, however. For them, the birds' strength and speed make them excellent companions for any sudden skirmish.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The tar creeper can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

trait.name: Tar Stench
entries: Any creature other than a tar creeper that starts its turn within 5 feet of the tar creeper must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all tar creepers for 1 hour.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tar Spray (1/Day)
entries: The tar creeper sprays sticky tar in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw a creature's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions.
A creature can remove the tar on itself during a short or long rest by bathing in water, alcohol, or vinegar.

Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the thistleshrub can only make one claw attack.

action.name: Entangling Roots {@recharge 5}
entries: Grasping thorny roots and vines sprout in a 15-foot radius centered on the thistleshrub, withering away after 1 minute. For the duration, that area is difficult terrain for non-plant creatures. In addition, each creature of the thistleshrub's choice in that area when the plants appear must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained}. While {@condition restrained} in this way, the target takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage at the start of their turn. A creature can use its action to make a {@dc 14} Strength check, freeing itself or another entangled creature within reach on a success.

action.name: Devour
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage. A Medium or smaller target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or swallowed by the lizard. The lizard can only have one target swallowed at a time. If a target fails the saving throw while the lizard has a creature swallowed, it is {@condition grappled} instead.

A swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the lizard, and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the lizard's turns.

If the lizard takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the lizard must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the lizard. If the lizard dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage

trait.name: Water Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Freeze
entries: If the elemental takes cold damage, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Whelm {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature in the elemental's space must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If it is Large or smaller, it is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. If the saving throw is successful, the target is pushed out of the elemental's space.

The elemental can grapple one Large creature or up to two Medium or smaller creatures at one time. At the start of each of the elemental's turns, each target {@condition grappled} by it takes 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. A creature within 5 feet of the elemental can pull a creature or object out of it by taking an action to make a {@dc 14} Strength and succeeding.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The whale can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The whale can hold its breath for 30 minutes

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The whale has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 5d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The whale shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The whale shark can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The whale shark makes three bite attacks. It can make one tail attack in place of one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 3d12 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature affected by the whale shark's Inhale, that creature is swallowed. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the whale shark, and it takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the whale shark's turns.

If the whale shark takes 40 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the whale shark must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the whale shark. If the whale shark dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from the whale shark and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Inhale
entries: The whale shark inhales water in a 15-foot cube in front of it. Each creature in that cube that is Large or smaller must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or have their movement speed reduced to 0 until the end of the whale shark's next turn.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The serpent has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the wind serpent can't constrict another target.

action.name: Lightning Breath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The serpent exhales lightning in a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

variant.name: Adapted Wind Serpents
entries: Wind serpents are found throughout Azeroth and have adapted differently to their climate.
You can change a wind serpent's {@b {@i lightning breath}} attack to deal {@b {@i cold}} or {@b {@i  poison}} damage instead of lightning by making the following changes to the attacks:

entries.name: Breath Attack.
entries: The breath attack becomes a 20-foot cone, and requires a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw to resist.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The serpent has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Venomous Bite
entries: Once per turn, the serpent can deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage with its bite to a target that doesn't have all its hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The serpent makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its constrict.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the wind serpent can't constrict another target.

action.name: Shocking Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one creature. {@h}The target must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

variant.name: Adapted Wind Serpents
entries: Wind serpents are found throughout Azeroth and have adapted differently to their climate.
You can change a wind serpent's {@b {@i shocking spit}} attack to deal {@b {@i cold}} or {@b {@i  poison}} damage instead of lightning by making the following changes to the attacks:

entries.name: Spit.
entries: The breath attack requires a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw to resist.

monster.name: Wisp
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The wisp can't wear or carry anything.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Variable Illumination
entries: The wisp sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.

action.name: Intertwine
entries: The wisp enters the space of another creature and attempts entwine it in place. The target must pass a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. At the end of the target's turns, it can make another save, ending the paralysis on a successful one. While the wisp has a creature intertwined, attack rolls against it has disadvantage. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this wisp's intertwine for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Renew {@recharge 5}
entries: One plant that the wisp can see within 5 feet of it is renewed by the wisp; the wisp disappears. The wisp can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect while renewing a plant. The renewed plant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the plant takes fire damage, the renew doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The plant dies if it starts its turn with 0 hit points.

The renew lasts until the renewed plant drops to 0 hit points, the wisp ends it as a bonus action. When the plant takes damage, the wisp must pass a Concentration saving throw (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell) or be pushed out of the plant.

variant.name: Will of the Forest
entries: Five wisps within 30 feet of each other are able to cast powerful spells. Each of the five must use its action and movement on three consecutive turns to call upon the powers of Elune and must maintain {@status concentration} while doing so (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). When all five have finished their third turn of the ritual, the wisps gain the Spellcasting trait and can cast one spell in total at a target or point within 120 feet, no matter the spells normal range.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: The wisps spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}). They can innately cast one of the following spells as a 4th-level spell, requiring no material components. If a spell requires {@status concentration}, all five wisps {@status concentration} must be broken to remove the spell:
1/ritual: {@i {@spell banishment}, {@spell charm monster}, {@spell confusion}, {@spell dispel magic}, {@spell spike growth}, {@spell wind wall}}

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The wolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The worg has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

monster.name: Wraith

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks and weapons that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Create Spawn
entries: The wraith targets a humanoid within 10 feet of it that died a violent death and has been dead for no longer than 1 minute. The target's spirit rises as a wraith spawn in an unoccupied space by the corpse, under the wraith's control. The wraith spawn has the same statistics as the wraith, except that it has an Intelligence and Charisma score of 1, it cannot speak or use Create Spawn, and its Life Drain does not reduce a target creature's hit point maximum. The wraith can have no more than two wraith spawns active under its control at one time.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wretched's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 11}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material component

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The wretched has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the yak moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the yak can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the yeti moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 12 ({@damage 2d10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The yeti makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) cold damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@dice 1d10 + 4}) piercing.

action.name: Roar
entries: The yeti emits a roar. Each creature within 30 feet of the yeti and able to hear the roar must make a DC10 Wisdom saving throw, being Frightened for 1 minute on a fail. A Frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the roar of all yetis for 1 day.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The dragonhawk has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the dragonhawk is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragonhawk makes two attacks with its talons.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The dragonhawk exhales fire  in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The sabercat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the tiger moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the tiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the zhevra moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the zhevra can make one attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

A {@b zhevra} resembles a large, striped horse with a horn piercing through its forehead, similar to that of a unicorn. Though they might seem threatening, they are usually very passive beasts; remarkably easy to frighten. They move together in herds, keeping close for their own protection.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: While out of water, the zoatroid can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The zoatroid can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until the grapple ends, the zoatroid shares space with it, the target is {@condition blinded}, and the zoatroid can't use its tentacles on another target without ending the grapple.

action.name: Enslave {@recharge}
entries: One humanoid {@condition grappled} by the zoatroid must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be enslaved by the zoatroid; the enslaved target goes on the zoatroids initiative, it controls the target's body using its actions, but it doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies. The enslave deprives the target of its vision but not its awareness. The zoatroid can be targeted by attacks, spells, and other effects, but any attack roll that misses it automatically hits its enslaved target.
The enslavement lasts until the target drops to 0 hit points, the zoatroid ends it as a bonus action, or a creature uses their action to attempt a grapple check contested by the zoatroid.

action.name: Fogged Mind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Each non-aberration creature within 10 feet of the zoatroid must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

reaction.name: Reactive Shield
entries: The zoatroid forces an attack roll that would hit it to instead hit its enslaved target. To do so, the zoatroid must be able to see the attacker.

monster.name: Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life  but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 +the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.
